components.description:
A postbox (mailbox, letterbox) with a letter in its slot for collection. Generally depicted in red with a white envelope, styled after public postboxes in Japan. May also evoke postboxes in the United Kingdom.

Used for various content concerning postal deliveries and email. Microsoft’s design was previously blue, after U.S. mail collection boxes.
components.title: Postbox

description:
A postbox (mailbox, letterbox) with a letter in its slot for collection. Generally depicted in red with a white envelope, styled after public postboxes in Japan. May also evoke postboxes in the United Kingdom.

Used for various content concerning postal deliveries and email. Microsoft’s design was previously blue, after U.S. mail collection boxes.
title: Postbox

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Communication symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A postbox, where letters and other mail are posted, in order to be delivered. Postbox was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added  http://emojipedia.org/postbox/
emoji_net_data.name: postbox

bn:00089246v: Get something; come into possession of
To be handed something; to come into possession of.

bn:00088773v: To send (a letter, parcel, etc.) through the mail.

bn:00031067n: A flat (usually rectangular) container for a letter, thin package, etc.

bn:00029345n: Electronic mail, most commonly referred to as email or e-mail since, is a method of exchanging digital messages from an author to one or more recipients.
A message sent via an e-mail system.

A string that identifies a user so that the user can receive Internet email. An email address on the Internet typically consists of an account name, followed by the @ (at) symbol, a host name, and a domain name.

Information at the top of an e-mail message, including the name and address of the sender and recipient, the date and time sent, the subject, and other information that is not part of the body text of the message. The mail header is used by an e-mail client or program.
Information or message that is transmitted or exchanged from one computer terminal to another, through telecommunication.
An app for sending and receiving email.
A folder that stores messages that have been created but not yet sent.
A message that is sent over a communications network such as a local area network or the Internet.

(computer science) a system of world-wide electronic communication in which a computer user can compose a message at one terminal that can be regenerated at the recipient's terminal when the recipient logs in
A notification issued when a message is received
A utility that allows the user to send and receive e-mail.
The exchange of text messages and computer files over a communications network, such as a local area network or the Internet.
Method of sending digital messages from an author to one or more recipients

bn:00050802n: A written message addressed to a person or organization
A letter is a written message from one party to another containing information.
A form of written communication; see also mail
A written message; a letter, note or memo.
A text that is written to and for a specific person or set of people (and is most commonly sent to them by post).
An activity that tracks the delivery of a letter. The activity can contain the electronic copy of the letter.
Written message containing information from one party to another

bn:00050808n: A post box is a physical box into which members of the public can deposit outgoing mail intended for collection by the agents of a country's postal service.
Public box for deposit of mail
A letter box, letterbox, letter plate, letter hole, deed, mail slot, or mailbox is a receptacle for receiving incoming mail at a private residence or business.
Letter hole, deed or mail slot), a private receptacle for incoming mail
A box into which mail is put
A public receptacle for outgoing mail
Box into which mail is put.
The location where email is delivered.
A box into which mail is delivered.

bn:00050809n: A private box for delivery of mail

bn:00052815n: The mail or post is a system for physically transporting documents and other small packages, as well as a name for the postcards, letters, and parcels themselves.
The letters, parcels etc delivered to a particular address or person.

Mail, or post, is a system for transporting letters and other tangible objects: written documents, typically enclosed in envelopes, and also small packages are delivered to destinations around the world.
The system whereby messages are transmitted via the post office
A message or topic published on a blog, message board or Help board.
A single delivery of letters; the letters or deliveries that make up a single batch delivered to one person or one address.
System for transporting documents and other small packages
A batch of letters and parcels received via post.

apple_vendor_description: The postbox emoji, as rendered on Apple devices, stands as a classic symbol of mail and communication, depicted with a deep, rich red and a subtly metallic sheen.  Its rounded edges and carefully applied gradients give it a friendly, approachable feel, reflecting Apple's signature 3D design.  This emoji is often used to signify sending or receiving letters, packages, or important correspondence.
